favourite.article: This song was in my first gospel piano/vocal music book, The Best of Sacred Music. I was a new Christian and loved this song. It has brought me much comfort. This morning the Lord sang it over me (Zephaniah 3:17). I had to find it again and meditate on it. I will be singing it all day long today. Thank You, Jesus, for this precious sweet song!
Carol: "Jesus died for sinful men - Amen! OPQRSTU - I believe God's Word is true. UVW - God has promised you - XYZ - A home eternally!" :)

As a child sang this and many others at BMA camp (Bible Memory Association) camp. Could not remember a few of the words. Senior moment. Thank you for refreshing my memory. ps: does anyone know the lyrics to the ABC song? It starts off ABCDEFG.. Jesus died for you and me HIJKLMN ........ Thank you in advance
I don't remember when I heard this song the first time. I am a missionary in Tonga, pastoring an international church, and it just came to me, this morning. I'll teach it to our church!
This was my mother's lullaby when I was little and now that I'm a mother, I sing it to my daughter. I never knew there was a second verse!! So very happy to have found this.
My grandfather, Orien Johnson, one of the founding members of Young Life, wrote this song.

I'm so glad to have found this lovely hymn. I remember the lyrics from my childhood, and wanted to bring it to my Sunday School class where we are studying Genesis. Genesis 3:8 "And they heard the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the cool of the day.... "Of course this song is about our relationship after we have confessed our sins and saved by His Grace. To me it's a picture of what heaven will be like. Thank you.
I have been searching for this song in all hymn books for many years. I love this song very much. l got it here. I am very........ happy.
Brings back sweet memories of giving my heart to Jesus in high school Young Life gathering, 1958. This was one of my favorites as I sang, thankful for discovering how much my Lord loves me.
I remember this hymn when I was in school used to sing this.
This song my mother sang to all 5 of us as a lullaby. Out walking just this morning in the rain soaked grass with my little one and it came back.
What a pleasure to hear this song. I learn this song at Bethel Bible Camp in 1969. I was singing it on the way home last night.

I learned this song when I was very young (around 10 years ago). I can remember this song well because it captivates my whole heart. It's such a melodic song with the very good meaning! I find it very wonderful.
I like this song so much. For many, many years I sang it. I love this song forever.

I learned this chorus 40 years ago from my youth leader Annette who was a medical student in Calcutta. I forgot about this song and recently the memories came back and I was delighted to hear this beautiful song with the lyrics. It just made my day! Thank you.

This song reminded me of how devoted young Christian I was way back 12 years ago.. :') I missed the song so much and repeat playing it again and again. The feeling does not change. The tune reminds me of no matter how far the distance I've walked all through out my life, I can still get back to God. Thank you for this.
1969-70 attended a YOUNG LIFE group retreat in Santa Cruz Mtns, Mount Herman. Such lasting impression, this song has had on me throughout my adult life...now I have all the verses~God Bless.
Thank you for this song. I sang this more than 20 years ago as a young Christian and recently the tune just came back. The lyrics here made it all complete!
What a memory jogger...I probably learned it at Sunnybrook Baptist Camp in 1963 or '64, the two summers I worked there. Good song.
Learned this song back in Chicago 50 years ahgo as a kid: at that time, if I remember rightly, it had been some prize-winning new hymn. Do we know who wrote/composed?

I love this because it brings back happy memories of Camp Sunnybrook nestled somewhere up in mountains of Pennsylvania. My friends Susan and Jan as well as some others would sing this and other songs as we rowed a boat around the lake. Camp Sunnybrook may have been affiliated with the American Baptist Churches of which I was a member (Plymouth Valley Baptist.
My friends and I sang this when I was a teenager, and I've loved it for years, singing it in my head. Thank you for these words and music.

Our youth group used to sing this on the bus to teen activities or mission trips. I was reading God's Word this morning and this tune and a few rough words popped in my head. It has been years since I sang it! I did a Google search and found the words and and the music. I had forgotten there was a girls/guys section! Thank you for posting!

I love this song, it's such a great song but also I have great memory as a kid singing this song with my mother. At church service for special music my mother and I would sing but she would also play the guitar. =)

I too have a melody running through my mind most of the time. I was working in the yard and this melody came to me. My daughter and I sing together and we are going to sing it for our church services. I do not think of it as a children's song at all. It is a wonderful thought. I like the additonal verses I have found also. It makes it like a full length song. Thanks for letting me find it here. I would love to have the piano music to print as it is played here as you read the lyrics.

What a wonderful site tonight as I see my Uncle Orien G Johnson's song is still being a blessing all over the world. He wrote it in 1956. The additional verses are NOT part of the original song. Thank you for your prayers for the family as Uncle Orien, my dad's oldest brother, just went to be with the Lord yesterday, January 9th, on the same day my father, his brother, Claude, passed 27 years ago to the day. I'm thankful that God is our Shepherd and we are His sheep. I cherish my many fun memories of him singing this with me. I love you Uncle Orien. You were and are such a blessing. He worked many years in Christian service and did this while working for Young Life in it's early founding years.

My sister and I learned this song at camp one year and my grandmother loved to hear us sing it. She just passed away today and my sister and I plan to sing it at her memorial, thank you for having it on here.

For the last year or so I wake up almost every morning with a hymn or chorus in my mind, I know it's Jesus waking me up like that. Today it was this song but I couldn't get the last verse right so I searched in my old hymnals and chorus books and couldn't find it. Then I found your website! Thank you, it's awesome! I am sure I will spend a lot of time here!! God bless you for the work you did for us to enjoy :)
I like it very much.

My sister and I sang this song to our Mother as she passing away last month. We both learned this song in summer camp, 40 odd years ago, but we could never remember the last verse and here it is. Thank you for putting it up on your site. I looked for this song in many Hymnals. Blessings from two sisters who loved their Mother.
I love this song but can you please add Chinese because I sing this song when I was kid back in 1982. Thanks for your works to put all these great songs here.
I love this song! I first heard it at summer camp and I think it's a very cute song!
I too have been looking for this song for years! It's so sweet and I wanted to teach it to my grandchildren. Thank you so very much!

Thank you so much for the lyrics. I have been looking for this song for years!! I was not aware of the second verse. I sang this as a child and would like to teach it to the children in our church. Was unable to download the piano score though.
Thank you for this site. I have been looking for the melody and the piano music for this song for months and I am very thankful to have found it! Thank you for this ministry.
